abstracts.cdata!:
The quick disbursing Rehabilitation
            Credit Project provides financial support for the first set
            of measures in Albania s economic recovery program. These
            measures aim to address some of the key structural
            weaknesses which have contributed to the recent crisis, and
            to alleviate the increased poverty and unemployment
            generated by the crisis. Specifically, the credit supports
            (1) the winding down of the pyramid schemes by appointing
            external administrators to control these companies operating
            the schemes, and to manage the recovery and distribution of
            their assets to depositors; (2) reforms in the banking
            sector including enhancing private sector participation in
            the three commercial and savings banks, as well as
            strengthening the legal and judicial framework, the
            financial infrastructure, and banking supervision; (3)
            increased budgetary outlays for social assistance through
            block grants to local authorities, especially to benefit the
            elderly and orphans, and increasing the involvement of
            nongovernmental organizations; and (4) employment promotion
            through community work programs, adjusting social insurance
            legislation, and implementing a new financing and accounting
            system for the unemployment insurance program. The Credit is
            closely coordinated with the conditions of structural reform
            in the financial sector approved under the IMF's
            post-conflict Emergency Assistance Program, which underpins
            the macroeconomic framework. The Credit will be released in
            a single tranche.
